Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup; glazed throughout; exterior: inscription on concave rim above carinated junction with body.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), North and west of Well B (Hogarth Site 35), found by 'Bedawi boys who search the rubbish heaps' (Hogarth 1898-9, 31)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Edgar, C.C. (1989-99) Excavations at Naukratis B: the inscribed and painted pottery p. 55 no. 78, and p.31. Höckmann & Möller 2006 no. 25.
Hogarth explains that this sherd was found north or west of the well marked 35 in the Hellenion. See Hogarth (1898/1899), p. 31.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 55, no. 78)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 702, no. 601)
Hogarth 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, A. Site and Buildings (p. 31, no. 78)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1608)
